result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Joseph Vsetecka

records.addlTxt: filed by DA's Office, on behalf of VW Office. bph

Defendant may coordinate through his father to retrieve personal belongings when victim is not at residence. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K. Vsetecka, Jr.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:21 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Anthony Joseph Vsetecka in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Anthony Joseph Vsetecka.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not qualify for PD.  DE confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Bond argument.  Court orders bond.  Money on file to be refunded to payor.  DE states he just lost his job so believes he'll qualify for PD. Court schedules next court date.  Adjourned at 1:27 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
